dialogues.text: Duncan enters. Trent, Kip, Joan and Pam are sitting on th BACK DECK. Joan, holding court. Pam, collecting everyone’ drinks to “refill.” Without even breaking from her “story Joan hands Pam her glass. Pam watches through the window Duncan passes by, never connecting with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole staff is gathered. Owen, passing out PAYCHECKS.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Roddy. He hands Roddy his check. OWEN (CONT’D) Lewis. Owen reaches over the back of him to Lewis. OWEN (CONT’D) Pop ‘N Lock! Duncan works his way through the crowd as they laugh, cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DUNCAN, woofing down some cereal, chugging orang juice. He’s hellbent to get on with his day. A different air to this “Duncan.” Very tan, healthy-looking. His hair shaggy.  60 61 62 63. PULL BACK to reveal STEPH just staring at him. Not sure w the hell this is. Duncan looks over, winks. EXT. WATERPARK - TOP OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY 60 Duncan is now on his own at “Peak Command.” He’s wearing classic Vaurnets a la Owen, spacing SLIDERS out with the greatest of ease, confident. Among the kids, Kyle, Jason Neil. EXT. WATERPARK - BOTTOM OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - MOMENTS L A variety of SLIDERS come shooting out of the tube one af the other. Suddenly, the flow of people stops. Beat. No activity. All of the sudden, three MATS come out of the tube. But, no Sliders. We hear a LOUD WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. WATERPARK - TOP OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - MOMENTS LATE Owen and Roddy run up. Duncan has the whistle in his hand

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (panicked) Sorry. They rushed me. They said it was for the good of science. Owen, Duncan, and Roddy look down the tube.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (yelling down tube) Guys, are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yelling) No, we’re not okay, dumbass. We’re stuck!

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (to Duncan/Roddy) Huh. Not sure how I’m the dumbass in this scenario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, Neil, and Jason are, in fact, stuck. They’re arms, legs, everything - tangled. Kyle, facing one way. Neil an Jason, the other. Water, rushing all around them.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I told you we shouldn’t all go at the same time!

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I thought it would work!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Shut up, Neil! Shut. Up. Neil! EXT. WATERPARK - TOP OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - MOMENTS LATE Owen hops up on the railing, addresses the sea of kids waiting on the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up. I need a hero. I’m holding out for a hero ‘til the end of the night. He’s gotta be strong. And he’s gotta be fast. And he’s gotta be fresh from the fight. (then, off the kids’ blank stares) No? Footloose? Bonnie Tyler song? Kevin Bacon drives a tractor ina game of “Chicken?” Still blank stares. OWEN (CONT’D) (giving up) I need someone to throw himself down the tube and knock some kids loose. A HAND rises from the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: KID'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I'll do it. The “volunteer” makes his way through the crowd. It’s a K alright. A quite obese one.  64 65 65. EXT. WATERPARK - TOP OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - MOMENTS LATE Duncan, Owen, and Roddy are now joined by MALCOLM (KID).

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: You're probably going to want to get some momentum, Mack.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (confident) I got this.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Owen, I don’t know if that’s a good idea. What if we just turn off the water? They could get their footing.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Let’s call that “Plan B.” (then, yelling into tube) I’m not going to lie to you. This is probably going to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yelling) What’s going to hurt who? Malcolm steps into the entrance of the tube. He grabs the sides and starts rocking back and forth. Finally, throwin himself down the tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Kyle, Jason and Neil, as they feel the tube ROCK they hear RUMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL/JASON
dialogues.text: What’s happening?!/I can’t see! KYLE'S POV of Malcolm coming at them, full speed. Kyle screams.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL/JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you screaming?!  66 66. EXT. WATERPARK - BOTTOM OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - CONTINUOU Kyle, Neil, Jason, and Malcolm come shooting out of the t in one big ball. Owen, Duncan, and Roddy run up. Owen jum in to help the guys to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (faux concern) Oh my God. Ming Lee, Ismael, Vladimir. I thought I lost you.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: That was awesome!

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let’s do it again!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (to Kid) Will you knock us loose?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (excited) Sure! Caitlin approaches, intercepts. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: Whoa. Whoa. We’re done with that. Thank you. The boys looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Owen) What do think you're doing!

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: It’s all good. No one got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: Don’t just wave it off! Places get shut down because of stunts like this!

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (to boys) Is it just me, or is she very sexy right now?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (checking her out) She's certainly got my attention.  67 68 69 67. Caitlin takes a breath, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Why do you always put me in this position? I hate being this person. This is why,... (then, indicates herself and him) «+. This doesn’t happen. It’s not fun anymore. (beat) I wish this wasn’t just a job. With that, she walks off. Duncan looks to Owen, whose clearly affected. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, I didn’t mean to...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: No. It’s my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s pouring rain. The place is locked up. The parking lo empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No activity here, either. The only difference is that the station wagon is covered with a tarp. Clearly, Trent does like it getting wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan stares out the window. Miserable. Trent sits on th couch, looking through the newspaper. Steph is painting h toe nails. Pam enters from kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: The soup needs a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: There’s a 1:15 and a 3:30. We could see one of those.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: No, let’s stay in. Do something we can all do together. As a family.  70 68.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: We can see a movie as a family. We could grab Kip and Joan and make an evening of it.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: I don’t feel like hanging out with Kip and Joan. I feel like hanging out with all of you. Pam holds her stare on Trent. She means it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CANDYLAND BOX. Faded, on it’s last legs. PULL BACK to reveal. The “family” sitting on the floor around the table. Pam, the only one smiling, trying to se them on her idea. She displays the box top.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: (pointing) It’s appropriate for people four to eight. So, we’re good. Tough sell. Steph studies the top of the box, and reads i

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: “Home Sweet Home.”

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s not hate it right away. (then, holding up game pieces) What color gingerbread character do you want to be, Trent? Trent doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: I have to be yellow! She grabs a pawn. LATER... CLOSE ON a “Gingerbread Character” moving from space to space. It gets to an area called “Gumdrop Pass.” PULL BACK to reveal Duncan. It’s his turn.  69.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Oh, look, you can take the shortcut there. There is, in fact, a “bridge” that allows you to jump ahe Duncan moves his “character” over the “bridge.”

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Whoa. No, he can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Yes, he can. He crosses the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (under his breath) This is so stupid. Duncan moves back and past the “bridge.”

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: No, you’re at the shortcut. So, take it. Trent picks up the DIRECTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (reading, pointedly) “If your Gingerbread Character pawn lands, by exact count, on the yellow space below the Gumdrop Pass, you can take the shortcut.” (then) “Exact count.” He picked a card with a blue square on it, so he has to go to a blue square.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t think it matters.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: If it didn’t matter, they wouldn’t put it in the directions.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: We can fudge the rule.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: (laughs ) “Fudge.” That’s good.  70.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (good-natured) Well then, I might as well go directly to the top of Candy Mountain with that argument. Trent moves his pawn.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No rules? There we go. I win. Pam moves his pawn back.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Fine. We'll play the way you're supposed to play. (then) Duncan, move to the correct place.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I already did.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Great. (getting up) Now, take my turn for me. I’m going to set the table for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Wait, what? No, you need to do it.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Duncan can move for me.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: No, you’re the one who wanted to play. So, play your turn. Pam takes a moment, then comes back to turn a card and sl it down.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Purple. Pam moves her pawn toward a purple square with force. The turns to go to the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: (cautiously) It’s two. You need to move two purple squares. (off Pam’s look) Sorry.  71 72 73 71. Pam takes a moment to collect herself, and then comes to move her pawn.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: There. And, I’ve landed... (for Trent's benefit) ... By exact count, at the shortcut, so, I'll be taking the “Rainbow Trail.” She does.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: See? You’re way ahead now.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: It’s Candyland, Trent. With that, she walks to the DINING ROOM, starts setting t table. Trent gives Duncan and Steph a “What’s with her look?” But, they don’t commiserate.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: It’s your turn, Steph. Long beat of silence. The only sounds are those of “game play.” A Gingerbread pawn being moved across the board. Suddenly, Pam slams down a PLATE.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: (in tears) It’s fucking Candyland! She storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is out. Remnants of the rain are still evident, puddles on the ground. The station wagon, now uncovered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan boards his bike. As he rides off, Susanna comes ou from behind her house, with her own bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan locks up his bike. Susanna watches from afar. She turns around and heads back the way they came.  74 75 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan enters, surprised to find... OWEN, opening up. He looks a little more put together than usual, professional He’s wiping down all the lounge chairs.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (noticing) It’s your day off. Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I figured we lost yesterday, so I thought I’d make it up. (then, knowingly) Why are you?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Thought I’d open the place. See what all the fuss is about. Duncan smiles. Just then, Caitlin walks up to the front gate, her KEYS out. She seems genuinely surprised to find the place already open AND to see Owen working. He beams. She strides past him, bemused but it’s not going to be th easy.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: Your shirt’s inside out. Owen looks. It, in fact, is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is stacking MATS.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So, this is where you run off to?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (confused) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: I followed you earlier. Then, went to grab my stuff. She holds up her BEACH BAG. Duncan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: What happened to “let it be yours?”  Suddenly, 73.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: Does your mom know that you work here?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: (impressed) «+. Nice. over the LOUD SPEAKER...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Duncan, to the Administrative Offices International. Duncan looks over his shoulder. Owen, Roddy, and Lewis ar standing very nearby. OWEN (CONT’D) (into PA) Duncan, please report to the Administrative Offices International. I have to announce this over the PA as my voice won't carry that far. My throat suffered major damage during an intense make- out session with Lewis’ mom. She has a forked tongue...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I don’t have a mom. I have two dads. In your face. Duncan looks back at Susanna.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: .-. Hold on a sec... Duncan walks over to the guys...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (goading) Who’s that, big guy?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Just a girl.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Just a girl? A girl who makes you blush?  74.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Susanna.

dialogues.speaker: RODDY
dialogues.text: You pussy hound. Duncan looks down at the ground, shuffling his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She’s... older than me.

dialogues.speaker: RODDY
dialogues.text: Then, why are you here talking to us and not over there, sealing the deal with that cougar?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Well,... Maybe if you guys hadn't called me over. Owen and Roddy react to Duncan’s hint of bravado. Duncan smiles and AS he walks off...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (into the PA system) Duncan, back to his lady friend. Duncan, to his lady friend. Please let her know that our conversation was entirely about her. In other news, this is extremely awkward for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is giving Susanna the tour, a la the one he got fr Owen.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Okay. Water Wizz Waterpark. It was built in the summer of ‘83. The creator never wanted the place to change. So, on his death bed, he said “The minute someone tries to repaint or update the waterpark, it needs to be destroyed.” Susanna laughs. Beat.  77 78 75.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off laugh) Huh. I didn’t get that joke as fast. They pass the SUNBATHING GIRLS on their lounge chairs.

dialogues.speaker: SUNBATHING GIRL
dialogues.text: (flirty) Hey, Pop ‘N Lock. They giggle.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (off Susanna) Don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF VIGNETTES
dialogues.text: - MUSSEL BEACH. Duncan and Susanna lounge by the giant wa pool. - LOCKERS. Susanna watches Duncan clean out wet clothes f a abandoned locker. - EMPLOYEE LOUNGE. Duncan and Susanna have lunch at one o the picnic tables. - It’s end of day. Park empty. Duncan and Susanna walk around the edge of the RIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan and Susanna are walking their bikes up the drivewa (NOTE: The station wagon is NOT in the driveway.)

dialogues.speaker: STEPH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot for ditching me, bitch. They both look up. Steph is sitting on the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: (lying) Oh. I wasn’t aware we had plans.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: I wasn’t aware you two had plans.  79 76.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: Sorry, we just...

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: I’ve got a ton of stuff going on in my life right now. So, it would have been nice to have a friend. Just then, Pam comes out of the screen door. Expectant, hoping to see someone who isn’t there. Realizing it’s jus the kids... Duncan glances over in the direction Pam had. DUNCAN'S POV of the missing station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Dinner’s almost ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam, Duncan and Steph are seated at the dining room table whole spread of food, untouched. Duncan looks over at the wall clock. 8:30 PM.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: No use in waiting. Let’s just eat. More silence. Just the sound of UTENSILS CLINKING against the plates. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: PAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (trying to push through) So,... How’s Chad, Steph?

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: We broke up.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Oh. I’m sorry. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: (off food) This is really good. They continue eating in silence.  80 81 82 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam, cleans dishes. Duncan wraps up the uneaten food. Ste approaches Pam, carrying plates. Pam motions for her to s them down. Steph nudges her away, takes over cleaning. INT. BEACH HOUSE - DUNCAN’S BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT 81 Duncan wakes up in bed. Something has stirred him. From DOWNSTAIRS, he hears the front door OPEN. Duncan looks ov at the alarm clock. 2:40 AM.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Duncan descends, softly. Peers around the wall. DUNCAN'S POV of Pam, sitting in a chair, arms crossed. Before her, standing, Trent.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Look, I’m sorry. I was out with Kip on his boat all day. And, we lost track of time. I would have called, but then it was late and I didn’t want to wake you.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Just tell me... (beat) ... If there’s something I should know.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: What are you talking about...?

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Don’t make me feel crazy. I’ve been through this. And, I... Trent kneels in front of her. He puts his hand on her fac gently caressing it.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: I'm right here. You have me. You always have. (beat) We're in this together. Remember?  83 78. With that, he puts his head in her lap. Duncan heads back the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan descends the STAIRS, finding Pam placing a large platter of PANCAKES on the table. She seems happy.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: (bright) Good morning. I’ve already made too many pancakes, so I hope you’re hungry...

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Where was he? Pam pauses. Then, smiles a desperate smile and attends to the table.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: He was with Kip. But, he’s here now. She exits into the KITCHEN. Duncan turns as Trent, comes down the STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (chipper) Morning, buddy. Duncan breezes past him.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. We don’t say, “Good morning?” Duncan locks eyes with him...

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Welcome home. .-. And heads outside. Trent hesitates, heads into the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 84 79. EXT. JOAN AND KIP’S HOUSE - NIGHT 84 Another party. Full swing. People are dancing. A giant bonfire. Tables, set up in the sand. At one, Trent, Pam, and Steph are eating. Duncan sits at the end of the table brooding. Betty joins, carrying a PLATE.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: How about this spread, huh? Where did Joan find the time to order take-out? Betty winks, Pam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if there’s one thing that travels really well, it’s fried food. Pam and Betty laugh. Trent knows better than to chime in.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: I must get Joan's recipe for Big Daddy’s menu. They laugh even harder, toasting Pam. Joan approaches, a little tipsy AND oddly donning a HEAD SCARF a la Pam. Pam smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Is everyone having a good time? Oh good, you got some food. Pam, I don’t know what I was thinking. I should of had you cater my party. Pam gives her best pleasant smile, takes a swig of wine.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Well, at least this way, you’re going to have lots of leftovers. Joan gives a forced smile. Betty returns the favor.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: New look?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: No. Just bad hair day. Then, turning her attention to Trent...  80.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, Mr. Ramsey, you've been avoiding me all night. And, I won’t have it. Not tonight. Joan grabs Trent’s arm, playfully trying to pull him up.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said I'd get you on that dance floor! Trent resists, but not enough. They head over toward the bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: And, they called me a C-U-N-T.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: You don’t have to keep spelling it. Just then, Kip joins the table, carrying a plate of food.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Joan found herself a victim, huh? Kip chuckles. That sits like a lead balloon with the grou

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) Kip, I expect to be inviting myself out onto your boat again. When should I plan to do that?

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: Ah, the motor’s out of commission. It has been all week. And will probably be longer until they get the parts. Duncan looks right at Pam, as she looks over at Trent and Joan, dancing. Pam’s eyes well up. She stands, her face drained of life, white.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: I think I’m going to grab a sweater. Excuse me. She turns and starts to walk away. Duncan stands.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: How much more do you need? Pam stops, but doesn’t turn around.  81.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do something, mom. You know what's happening. He’s sleeping with her. Do something about it! The table, silent. Duncan has the attention of the whole party. Trent and Joan, stop dancing.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Duncan,... She starts to walk away again.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s it! Walk away! It’s easier! It’s right in front of your face, mom! Trent comes over, grabs Duncan’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy... Duncan whips around, pulls free of Trent’s grasp.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Let go of me! I’m not talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Well, I’m talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (pointing at Joan) Just go screw her, asshole! I mean, you have already. (points to Pam) And, she's certainly not going to stop you! Are you, Mom?!

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Everybody knows what I’m talking about! Trent grabs Duncan by the arms. He breaks free, and pushe Trent back. There’s some force there. Trent is definitely thrown off balance, but gets his footing, goes for Duncan again. Just then, Kip steps in between them.  85

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa. Trent. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Enough! Both of you! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Fine. You don’t want to do anything about it? It’s your life, but it’s not mine. (then) I want to be with dad!

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Duncan,... Trent scoffs. Duncan looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to live with my father!

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Your father? Good luck with that... Duncan looks a little thrown, confused.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Trent, don’t...

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: He doesn’t want you, kid. Duncan stricken, looks at Pam.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: (pained) Duncan... Duncan takes off toward the beach, passing Susanna. 82. Kip turns to Joan. She sips her wine, and looks right at him. EXT. JOAN AND KIP’S HOUSE/BEACH - NIGHT - MOMENTS LATER 8 Duncan sits in the sand. Susanna approaches, sits. checks in with him, but his gaze is set on the water.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: I told you this place sucks. She  86 Susanna smiles, hoping to break the ice. No luck. SUSANNA (CONT’D) I talked to my dad today. I told him that we had chased ghost crabs. It made him very happy. Felt like he was here. “Did you tell him about the eyes?! You’ve got to tell him about their eyes!” He gets so excited... Still nothing from Duncan. She pushes on. SUSANNA (CONT’D) See, their eyes can rotate 360 degrees. They can see everything around them. But, they can’t look straight up. Which, makes it easy for birds to attack them. So, they have to gather food at night for safety. (then, shrugging) I don’t know. My dad finds it cool. He’s a dork. 83. Finally, Duncan looks at Susanna, who smiles. Impulsively he leans in, tries to kiss her. Caught off guard, she pul back. SUSANNA (CONT’D) Oh,... Beat. He tries again. SUSANNA (CONT’D) Duncan, wait. Duncan jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I just wanted... Sorry. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 Duncan rushes toward the STORAGE SHED. On the PORCH, Tren and Pam. Duncan slips under the porch, out of sight. DUNCAN'S POV through the SLATS...  84.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: I’m an asshole. You deserve better. But, I can be that. I have to be that. Come on, I need you. (beat) We need each other. He reaches for her hand. She makes a fist. Unwelcome. That said, she doesn’t walk away. Duncan’s seen enough. H scurries under the house, bumping into...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Duncan, startled, jumps. Peter is there, holding some act figures.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (hushed) ... Shut up, Peter... ANGLE ON Pam/Trent, looking in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: (calling out) --. Duncan? She starts to move toward the SIDE OF THE DECK. ANGLE ON Duncan and Peter, moving along underneath.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (whispering) Take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No. I...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (hushed) Please!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Duncan... Duncan hears Pam’s footsteps above them, approaching.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’l1l scream.  87 88 89 85. Duncan grapples, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan rides his bike. Peter, sits on the handlebars, smiling ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan and Peter approach. Duncan’s surprised to see a fe CARS in the parking lot. There are lights on in the Emplo Lounge. MUSIC from inside. Duncan and Peter scale the fence. Roddy and a group of GIRLS walk up, carrying cases beer. He opens one side of the gate.

dialogues.speaker: RODDY
dialogues.text: Or, you could just try opening the gate. Off Duncan’s look,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roddy enters, followed by Duncan/Peter, surveying the par The boys definitely stick out as the rest of the room is certainly of age. As for the decorations, minimal. Some strung up LIGHTS. FURNITURE has been pushed to the sides make room for a dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: RODDY
dialogues.text: (to Room) Be cool. Our boss is here and his pirate friend. ANGLE ON Owen with Partygoers. He heads over. Peter noticing a COOLER. Grabs a couple BEERS.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. I could use a cleansing ale. Just then, Owen intercepts, taking the beers.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Or, check them out from afar.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’ve thrown a few back before.  86.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I’ve spent a night in jail before. There’s a limit for everything. (to Duncan) What’s your friend’s name?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Peter.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Nice eye patch.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: You don’t sound too cool with it.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: My mom makes me wear it. She says my eye confuses people.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Oh, well now you have to show me. Peter takes it off. OWEN (CONT’D) Wait, she wants you to hide that? Is she insane? I’d kill to have that eye.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (smiles) You’re full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Seriously. You know how many bits I could do with it? Daring people to look me straight in the eye? That thing’s awesome. Peter beams. Then, something catches his attention...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (way too excited) No way! Pizza and chicken wings! (ALT: Mind if I mingle?) He takes off. Owen checks in with Duncan, who seems out o sorts.  90 87.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: So... What’s up, my man?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: You're having a party? There’s an air of disappointment in Duncan’s voice. Owen senses it.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: It’s a farewell for Lewis. Guess he was serious this time. Duncan nods. Beat. OWEN (CONT’D) «+. Did you need to talk to me? Duncan considers, but...

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Nah. Just wanted to hang out.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (considers, then) How about we say you hang out for a little bit? Okay? I’m sure you’1l be wanted home at some point. Duncan nods. Owen can tell he’s not himself. He puts his hand on Duncan’s shoulder, walks him over to the rest of GANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARTYGOERS/EMPLOYEES are dancing. Duncan grabs three piec of pizza off a TABLE. We STEADY CAM as he shuffles throug the “dance floor,” passing Peter, who’s thrashing around. Peter has quite a bit of CHICKEN WING sauce on his face. Peter tries to “grind” up on Caitlin. She politely pushes him away. We continue to STEADY CAM over to Lewis, opening GIFTS. Duncan hands pieces of pizza to Owen and Roddy. Lewis hol up a POOL LEAF SKIMMER with a giant BOW tied around it.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Owen, you shouldn’t have.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Hey. I went to three different places in the waterpark to find that. You can use it to catch thunder clouds. Peter dances by, BEER in hand. Without missing a beat, Ow takes that one from him, too. Duncan plants himself down between Roddy and Owen. He’s one of the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan, Owen, Caitlin, and Roddy lounge on the COUCHES. Caitlin, a little tipsy, starts making up a song about “W Wizz.” Roddy goads, encouraging her. ANGLE ON OWEN/DUNCAN. Duncan glances at Owen, who’s enjoy the fact that Caitlin is center stage and having fun agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen stands up on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (to Room) Alright, I think we need to hear a few parting words from our guest of honor...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (protesting) No, no... The crowd goads. Owen glances at Roddy, conspiratorially. Roddy, taking the cue, nudges Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: RODDY
dialogues.text: (to Duncan, conspicuously) You want to be part of a tradition? Duncan nods. They cross off.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (to Owen) I’m not opening myself up to some bit.  89.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: No, no. You've been a good friend. We're going to miss you. Plain and simple. That’s no bit. Lewis takes a moment.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Well,... I won’t say that I won’t totally miss some aspects of this place. It wasn’t completely void of decent times. I remember a couple of days that stick out as almost memorable. (beat, then genuine) I guess if there’s one thing I will miss dearly, it’s... Just then, a very powerful STREAM OF WATER nails Lewis ri in the face. ANGLE ON DUNCAN, armed with a major POWER SOAKER water gu

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (disbelief) Duncan,...?!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (deer in headlights) It’s... part of a tradition...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: What kind of warped tradition is that?! Duncan glances over at Roddy, catching him grinning. Duncan’s been duped.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lewis was pouring his heart out...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I was going to say “people.” I’11 miss the people... Suddenly, Lewis is nailed again in the face. ANGLE ON RODDY, now armed with a SOAKER as well.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seriously! My doctor said not to get water on my face...! He’s nailed AGAIN.  c90 90. ANGLE ON CAITLIN, now armed herself. Lewis, fed up, goes Caitlin’s soaker. She relents. And, with that... A free f all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is soaked. As is everybody. Duncan surveys a WA OF PHOTOS. Summers past at Water Wizz. DUNCAN'S POV of PHOTOS. Everyone’s accounted for. Owen, Caitlin, Roddy, Lewis... And, now, Duncan’s up there. He’ in his Water Wizz shirt, beaming for the camera. Duncan notices Owen approaching Caitlin. He hands her a TOWEL. ANGLE ON CAITLIN/OWEN.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Fun night.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: «+. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Look, I’m sorry. I’m developmentally challenged. It’s bad. Like, “very special episode” bad...

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: I was just frustrated...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: It just started out as one summer here and then turned into 3 years. And, that had a lot to do with you. I just don’t want to look back and regret that it should have only been one summer.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: You won't. ANGLE ON DUNCAN, as Owen kisses Caitlin. ANGLE ON OWEN/CAITLIN.  91 Ag1 92 gl. OWEN (CONT’D) Unless, this place gets swallowed up by a giant sinkhole. Then, you're going to wish you had gotten out sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has become a full on dance circle has formed. No one i holding back. Everyone takes a turn. Duncan, naturally shows off his new pop ‘n lock moves. Finally, Peter is up dancing his ass off. They cheer as...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I’m feeling the beat. Suddenly,... He VOMITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen emerges. Outside, passed out Partygoers on lounge chairs. Remnants of the party strewn about. Owen looks up at HURRICANE HILL. OWEN POV of Duncan up at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan sits on the railing. The sun just about to come up Owen approaches.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: I said you could hang out for a little bit. And, I meant it. Sunrise of the next day is where I have to draw the line. (then) You need to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I wish I could stay here forever. Owen sits.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Oh well then, you're going to love the winters. They’re pretty spectacular. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: OWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Painting houses until it gets too cold, bar backing at some dive to scrape rent together, talking to inanimate objects...

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I’m serious.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: I am, too. There’s a whole world out there for you, Duncan. Don’t settle, just yet.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I don’t have anywhere else to go.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: I bet that’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: This is the only place I’m happy. Duncan starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Trent. My mom’s boyfriend. He said I was a three. He asked me what I thought I was on a scale from one to ten. He said I was a three. (beat) Who says that to somebody?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Someone who doesn’t know you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t even want to answer! I... shouldn’t have to answer!

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Listen to me. That’s about him, man. That’s all about him. It’s got nothing to do with you. Duncan looks at him.  93 94

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Because my father was the same way. (then) And that’s why I hate patterns. And that’s why you can’t buy into that shit. And that’s why you gotta go your own way. Owen smiles. OWEN (CONT’D) And you, my friend, are going your own way.
93 Peter is passed out on a lounge chair, as is everybody el Caitlin is cleaning up. Owen gently shakes Peter.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Rise and shine, Patches. Peter wakes up, letting out a loud STRETCH.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Last night was awesome. Did I get laid? Duncan and Owen shocked, laugh.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I feel like I did. Did I? They laugh even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is riding his bike, Peter on the handlebars. then...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Stop. Stop! Peter jumps off, tries to puke. But, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m okay. 94 Beat, He hops back on the handlebars. They ride a few feet.  95 94.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop. Stop! He jumps off again. Tries to puke. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (jumping on handlebars) Man, I’m never drinking again. A few feet.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That night was epic. (then) Stop. Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan and Peter ride up on the bike. The station wagon door’s are open. There are already bags inside. Susanna i up on her deck.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: (seeing them, calling into house) Mom, they’re back! Suddenly, Betty bursts out, runs down stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: (to Peter) Where the hell have you been all night, young man!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Not now, woman. Peter walks right past his mom, heads up the stairs. Bett follows.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: What did you just say to me?!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We'll talk when I get up.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Don’t you walk away... And, where the hell is your eye patch?! With that, they’re gone. Susanna looks at Duncan, then follows them inside.  96 95. ANGLE ON Trent exiting his house, carrying bags.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (calling inside) Pam, he’s here. Trent puts down the bags.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were worried about you, buddy. Duncan’s confused. Why the good mood?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen. Let’s forget about last night. How does that sound? Start fresh. Clean slate. What do you say, buddy? Trent pats his head, walks over to the car. Duncan heads into the house, passing Steph on the STAIRS, who’s exitin with her BAG.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: I hope you’re happy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan walks into the doorway. Pam is packing a suitcase, her back to Duncan. From her eyes, we can tell it has bee hard night. She looks exhausted, drained.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Pam doesn’t turn around.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: We're leaving. I need you to get your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Mom, I’m sorry. The tears come back. She keeps her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: I know. Me too. Beat.  96.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: But, why do you and I have to go? The summer’s not over...

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Duncan,...

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: We can stay somewhere else. I don’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: We want to leave early, so that’s what we're doing!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: So,... We’re going with them? Pam doesn’t respond. She knows what he’s really asking. S collects herself, turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: I don’t expect you to understand... His face says it all. “Unbelievable.”

dialogues.speaker: PAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're fourteen. And, I know that means you think you know everything but... We do things... Pam struggles. This doesn’t come easy.

dialogues.speaker: PAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. We do things to... protect ourselves. Because we’re scared. Scared of... Being at a place again that we don’t know if we can handle. So,... We look the other way. We convince ourselves that we can make it work... Because, we need it to.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (short, clarifying) We're leaving with them. Pam looks down. Ashamed. Duncan’s stare is too hard to face. Beat. He leaves. Pam sits on the edge of her bed.  97 98 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody’s now out front. Trent puts the last bag, close the back to the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Is that it? No one answers. He goes to lock up. ANGLE ON PAM/BETTY.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Thanks for everything. Betty hugs her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: I think you’re great. ANGLE ON SUSANNA/DUNCAN at the station wagon door.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: So, I guess... We’re leaving. (beat) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: SUSANNA
dialogues.text: Goodbye. Duncan starts to climb into the way back. Susanna taps hi shoulder. He turns. She leans in, kisses him. It’s a grea kiss. SUSANNA (CONT’D) You just surprised me, that’s all. She smiles, walks off. Duncan climbs into the back. As he does, he notices Steph, staring.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: What are you looking at, perv? He proudly takes his back bench seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls out the driveway. DUNCAN'S POV OF SUSANNA WAVING. Betty approaches her, put her arm around her daughter. Susanna leans into her mothe Now at a good distance, we can no longer see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon heads out through the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan sits in the back, lost in thought. He glances out SIDE WINDOW. DUNCAN'S POV of passing by the Water Wizz main entrance. EXT. GAS STATION - DAY - MOMENTS LATER c98 The station wagon pulls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON GAS PUMP HANDLE in the GAS TANK. PULL BACK to reveal Trent, pumping gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the GLASS, we see Pam, staring off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the GLASS, we see Duncan, staring off as well. DUNCAN'S POV through the GLASS of Water Wizz in the dista PUSH IN on Duncan, contemplating. CLOSE ON DOOR HANDLE, popping. HIGH ARIEL SHOT of the REAR DOOR, swinging open. Duncan jumps out and PAN UP as he runs across the PARKING LOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam, startled, looks back over the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Duncan,...?! Steph pops up from the back seat, checking out the action She was clearly stretched out, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam jumps out, chasing after Duncan. She passes Trent, wh still pumping gas. Trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan, like a man on a mission, runs right up to Owen. Neil, Jason, and Kyle are there.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I came to say goodbye. Come on. Duncan walks off. Owen looks to the guys, puzzled. They follow Duncan. Pam, a little frazzled, enters the EMPLOYE GATE, surveying this strange land. EXT. WATERPARK - TOP OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - MOMENTS LATE CLOSE ON DUNCAN.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: We're going down, Hot Rod. I’m passing him. PULL BACK to REVEAL Duncan, Owen, Kyle, Jason, Neil, and Roddy at the mouth of the slide. Kyle runs to the railing

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (calling down) Pop ‘n Lock’s going for it! He’s gonna try to pass Owen on the slide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam notices a plaque hanging on one of the MAIN OFFICE wa  103 104 105 100. CLOSE ON PLAQUE. It reads, “Employee of the Month. Pop ‘N Lock.” And, there's a picture of Duncan. Pam notices PATRONS filing past her, as Trent/Steph step behind her, even more lost than she is. Curious, Pam foll the natural flow of people. Trent and Steph, less enthuse EXT. WATERPARK - BOTTOM OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - CONTINUOU A large crowd gathers at the base. Pam, Trent, and Steph join them, not sure what they’re there to see.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Pop ‘n Lock! Pop ‘n Lock! EXT. WATERPARK - TOP OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - CONTINUOUS 1

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: So, how do you plan to do it?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What makes you think you can?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Don’t die wondering, man. Owen smiles. He likes seeing this side of Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Owen) You go first. I’11 follow right behind you. Owen, like Malcolm had before, tries to get some momentum grabbing the sides. Duncan stands close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One, two, three... Go! Owen launches himself into the tube. Duncan jumps in, rig on his tail, face first. EXT. WATERPARK - BOTTOM OF DEVIL’S PEAK - DAY - CONTINUOU The crowd stares in silence, including Pam and Trent and Steph. They don’t know what they’re looking for, but they can’t take their eyes off the tube.  101. Caitlin approaches, standing right next to Pam. She's wondering what the hell is going on as well. Time seems to have stopped. Beat, after beat passes. Peop strain to see, taut with anticipation. Only the gentle sounds of LAPPING WAVES can be heard. Until, all of the sudden.... .--like the tube is giving birth,... Duncan comes shooting out, followed by Owen, cradled by w of water! The crowd cheers. Pam takes this in. Owen holds up Duncan arm in victory, as they start to climb out of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the first person to ever pass someone on the water slide! The crowd CHEERS. Duncan looks up, confused. Owen winks. Then, Duncan smiles, proud. Just then, Kyle, Neil and Jas run down.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: How did you do it?!

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Can’t tell you, my man. That’s our secret. Duncan smiles. The CROWD swarms. Just then, Pam breaks through the crowd, locks eyes with Duncan. She’s beside herself.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Mom, this is Owen. My friend who drives. (then) Owen, my mom.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: It’s a pleasure to meet you. She shakes his hand, but Pam can barely take her eyes off Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: .«-. Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: You've got a helluva a kid here.  102. Trent steps up behind Pam.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Are we done?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (exaggerated pleasance) Oh, and this must be Trent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen shakes Trent’s hand, pulling him in, invading his sp OWEN (CONT’D) Hi. I’m Owen, a good friend of “the three.”

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Hey. Let’s go. With that, Trent reaches for Duncan. Owen steps in the wa blocks him. Trent tries to move to the other side, but Ow shifts and blocks again. TRENT (CONT’D) (giving up) I’ll be in the car. He turns and walks off. Pam is still taking in the “new” Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Mom, can you give us a second?

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: (coming to) Oh. Of course. As if in a trance, Pam walks off.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Roddy.

dialogues.speaker: RODDY
dialogues.text: Pop ‘n Lock.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Caitlin.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLIN
dialogues.text: (smiling) Take care, Duncan. We’1ll miss you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Bye, Lewis.  106 103. ANGLE ON Lewis, still in the RENTAL SHACK. Still at the waterpark.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Duncan takes beat. Those were the easy “goodbyes.” Owen, looks at him, expectant.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Come on, my man. Shorter conversations... Duncan hugs Owen.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Eventually, Duncan breaks away. As he does, Owen slips hi arm around Caitlin’s waist. This time, she doesn’t remove it. They watch as Duncan heads to the front entrance. He doesn’t look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like how we began, Duncan is in the way, way back. Tan an SOPPING WET. Smiling, ear to ear. Pam stares out her window, lost in thought. Beat. Trent glances into the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: So, what? That’s where you’ve been running off to all summer? Those were the friends you made?

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Trent...

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: I’m just curious... (to Duncan) If that’s aiming higher...? If that’s the score you want to settle on, buddy...?

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Stop it. She looks at Trent, daggers.  107 108 104.

dialogues.speaker: PAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All you are to us is a ride home. With that, as if possessed by something bigger than herse Pam unbuckles her seat belt. With one fluid motion, she climbs over the front seat, accidentally(?) hitting the b of Trent’s head with her foot.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: What the hell, Pam...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam continues over the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam climbs over Steph and joins her son. They just sit, staring straight ahead. No need to check in with each oth They're on the same page. For now, they need only enjoy t view from the way, way back. And, just as the slightest h of a smile comes to Duncan’s face, we.... FADE OUT.
